[NA]

A11. Was the conflict of interest included?
"We thank the following colleagues who replied to our request for knowledge of any published or unpublished RCTs: Frederic Gottrand; Lewis Spitz; David Lloyd; Carlo Di-Lorenzo; Ciro Esposito; Benjamin Gold; Hisayoshi Kawahara; Yvan Vandenplas; David Gremse; Eric Hassall; Susan Orenstein; Vasundhara Tolia; Jacob Langer; Ralf Heine."
Conflicts of interest for the review authors were reported. Since no studies were included, no assessment of conflicts of interest for individual studies was needed.
[Yes]

P1. Identify the report as a systematic review, meta-analysis, or both.
"Fundoplication versus postoperative medication for gastro-oesophageal reflux in children with neurological impairment undergoing gastrostomy (Review)"
The title identifies the report as a systematic review.
[Yes]

P2. Structured summary: 
"Abstract / Structured summary: Provide a structured summary including, as applicable: background; objectives; data sources; study eligibility criteria, participants, and interventions; study appraisal and synthesis methods; results; limitations; conclusions and implications of key findings; systematic review registration number."
A structured abstract is provided.
[Yes]

P3. Describe the rationale for the review in the context of what is already known.
"[Children with neurological impairments frequently experience profound feeding difficulties, which can lead to malnutrition and growth failure.]"
The introduction describes the rationale and context for the review.
[Yes]

P4. Provide an explicit statement of questions being addressed. 
"[To compare the effectiveness of antireflux surgery and antireflux medications for children with neurological impairment and GOR who are undergoing placement of a gastrostomy feeding tube.]"
The objectives explicitly state the questions being addressed regarding participants, interventions, comparisons, and outcomes.
[Yes]

P5. Indicate if a review protocol exists and provide registration information.
"Protocol first published: Issue 3, 2006"
The existence of a protocol is indicated along with where it can be accessed.
[Yes]

P6. Specify study characteristics and report characteristics used as criteria for eligibility.
"[We sought to include randomised controlled trials that recruited children up to the age of 18 years with neurological impairments and GOR who were undergoing gastrostomy tube insertion.]"
Eligibility criteria regarding participants, interventions, study design, and other characteristics are described.
[Yes]

P7. Describe all information sources in the search and date last searched.
"[We searched the following databases on 23 March 2012: the Cochrane Central Register of Controlled Trials (CENTRAL), Ovid MEDLINE, EMBASE, CINAHL, LILACS and ISI Web of Science.]"
The information sources searched are described along with dates of coverage/last searched date.
[Yes]

P8. Present full electronic search strategy for at least one database. 
"Appendix 1 for the most recent search strategies and Appendix 2 for the original and 2009 update search strategies."
The full search strategy for at least one database is provided in the appendix.
[Yes]

P9. State the process for selecting studies.
"Titles and abstracts of studies will be identified from the search and read independently by two review authors (AVR and PBS). Those that do not meet the inclusion criteria will be discarded and any disagreements over suitability for inclusion will be resolved by discussion or adjudication, or both by editors of the Cochrane Developmental, Psychosocial and Learning Problems Group."
The process for study screening and selection is described.
[Yes]

P10. Describe method of data extraction and confirmation.
"Data extraction forms will be designed to include study design, participant characteristics, study setting, intervention type and outcomes. Data will be extracted independently by two review authors (AVR and PBS) and disagreements will be resolved through discussion or by contacting the study author for further information."
The process for data extraction is described, including having two independent extractors.
[Yes]

P11. List and define all variables for which data were sought.
"Primary outcomes: Resolution of clinically measured, identifiable symptoms of GOR following gastrostomy surgery. Secondary outcomes: Adverse events: morbidity - including wrap failure, retching, dumping, dysphagia, drug side effects and interactions; Adverse events: mortality; Pain: measured by parental reporting, behavioural observations; Health-related quality of life for child or carer, or both: measured using validated scales."
Outcomes and other variables for which data were sought are defined.
[Yes]

P12. Describe methods for assessing risk of bias of individual studies. 
"Selected studies will be independently evaluated by two review authors (AVR and PBS) using The Cochrane Collaboration's tool for assessing the risk of bias (Higgins 2011)." 
The use of the Cochrane risk of bias tool is described.
[Yes] 

P13. State the principal summary measures.
"For dichotomous data, the risk ratio and its 95% confidence interval will be calculated. For studies using standardised assessment tools that have generated a scored outcome measure, we will calculate a mean difference. For studies using different scales, we will calculate the standardised difference in means with a 95% confidence interval."
The intended summary measures for different types of data are stated.
[Yes]

P14. Describe the methods of handling data and combining results of studies.
No studies were included, so no quantitative synthesis was performed.
[NA]

P15. Specify any assessment of risk of bias across studies.
No assessment of risk of bias across studies was performed since no studies were included.
[NA]  

P16. Describe methods of additional analyses.
No additional analyses were performed since no studies were included.
[NA]

P17. Give numbers of studies screened, assessed for eligibility, and included, with reasons for exclusion. 
"Figure 1 shows a study flow diagram including the number of identified reports, duplicates and discarded studies."
A study flow diagram is provided detailing the screening process and reasons for exclusion.
[Yes]

P18. For each study, present characteristics and provide citations.
No studies were included.
[NA]

P19. Present data on risk of bias for each study. 
No studies were included so no assessment of risk of bias was performed.
[NA]

P20. For each study, present simple summary data for each intervention group and effect estimates.
No studies were included so no study data or effect estimates are presented.
[NA] 

P21. Present results of meta-analyses done, including confidence intervals and measures of consistency.
No meta-analysis was performed since no studies were included.
[NA]

P22. Present results of any assessment of risk of bias across studies.
No assessment of risk of bias across studies was performed since no studies were included.
[NA]

P23. Give results of additional analyses, if done.
No additional analyses were performed since no studies were included.
[NA]

P24. Summarize the main findings including the strength of evidence for each main outcome.
"This review has demonstrated that there is no evidence available from reliable sources on which to draw any conclusions. We cannot provide data on the comparable risks or benefits of either treatment and are subsequently unable to provide recommendations for the best approach in this group of children."
The lack of evidence is summarized.
[Yes]

P25. Discuss limitations at study and outcome level, and at review level.
"There remains considerable uncertainty regarding the optimal treatment when faced with the decision of fundoplication surgery versus antireflux medications for children with GOR and neurological impairment who are undergoing gastrostomy insertion. There is a need for robust scientific evidence in order to provide data on the comparable risks or benefits of the two interventions."
The lack of included studies is discussed as a limitation.
[Yes]

P26. Provide a general interpretation of results in the context of other evidence. 
"This review aims to assess the efficacy of fundoplication for neurologically impaired children who are at a high risk of ARP failure compared with medical antireflux treatment. This is clinically important as there is some evidence of poor outcomes from surgery and the uncontrolled studies suggest that PPIs may be a safe, appropriate, cost-effective alternative (Heudebert 1997; Hassall 2000; Cheung 2001)."
The lack of evidence is interpreted in the context of other non-randomized studies.
[Yes]

P27. Describe sources of funding and other support, and the role of funders.
"Angharad Vernon-Roberts was funded by Cerebra (Charity for Brain Injured Children and Young People)."
Sources of funding and support are described.
[Yes]

In summary, for the AMSTAR assessment, 10 items were rated "Yes", 1 item was "NA", and no items were rated "No". For the PRISMA assessment, 18 items were rated "Yes", 9 items were "NA", and no items were rated "No". This systematic review without meta-analysis seems to be of good methodological quality based on the AMSTAR and PRISMA tools. The main limitation is the lack of eligible randomized controlled trials for inclusion.

llm_message:
Here are the assessments for the AMSTAR and PRISMA items:

A1. [Yes] "The PubMed, Embase and Cochrane databases were searched using the terms: hypospadias, Snodgrass, TIP*, tubularized incised plate, tubularized incised-plate, Mathieu*, perimeatal-based flap, perimeatal flap, meatal-based flap and meatal based flap." The review had an a priori design with predefined inclusion criteria and search terms.

A2. [Yes] "The eligibility determination, quality assessment and data extraction for each study were conducted independently by two of the authors (FRW and YHX) and conflicts were resolved by a third author (HJZ)." There was duplicate study selection and data extraction. 

A3. [Yes] "The PubMed, Embase and Cochrane databases were searched" [...] "All titles and abstracts were reviewed initially to select studies for full review if they contained results of primary hypospadias repair including both the PBF and TIP techniques. Where the relevance of a study was unclear a review of the full text was undertaken. The references of included studies were reviewed by hand searching to identify any additional articles." At least two databases were searched along with supplementary hand searching.

A4. [No] The review did not state whether grey literature was searched or used as an inclusion criterion.

A5. [No] The review did not provide a list of included and excluded studies.

A6. [Yes] "We extracted data from each study using a predefined data extraction form. The variables assessed included first author, publication year and type, level of evidence, patient age and number, length of follow-up, patient characteristics, surgical techniques and details (coverage of the neo-urethra, suture material and fashion, urinary diversion), and postoperative outcomes (fistula, meatal stenosis, wound dehiscence and cosmesis)." Characteristics of included studies were provided in Tables 1 and 2.

A7. [No] The review did not describe methods for assessing risk of bias of individual studies.

A8. [NA] Risk of bias was not assessed, so using it in formulating conclusions is not applicable.

A9. [NA] There was no quantitative synthesis or meta-analysis performed. 

A10. [NA] Assessment of publication bias is not applicable without a meta-analysis.

A11. [No] Sources of support were not reported for included studies.

P1. [Yes] "Systematic review and meta-analysis of studies comparing the perimeatal-based flap and tubularized incised-plate techniques for primary hypospadias repair" The title identifies the report as a systematic review.

P2. [Yes] The abstract provides a structured summary including objectives, data sources, study eligibility criteria, participants, interventions, results, and conclusions.

P3. [Yes] The introduction describes the rationale and context for the review.

P4. [Yes] "To conduct a systematic review and meta-analysis of studies comparing the PBF and TIP techniques for primary hypospadias repair and determine whether the two techniques had similar reported outcomes." The objectives state the participants, interventions, comparisons, and outcomes. 

P5. [No] The review did not report whether a protocol exists or provide registration information.

P6. [Yes] The methods specify inclusion criteria regarding population, interventions, study design, and outcomes.

P7. [Yes] The methods describe the literature sources searched and date of last search.

P8. [Yes] The full search strategy for PubMed is provided in the Appendix.

P9. [Yes] The methods describe the process of study screening, eligibility, and inclusion. 

P10. [Yes] "The eligibility determination, quality assessment and data extraction for each study were conducted independently by two of the authors (FRW and YHX) and conflicts were resolved by a third author (HJZ)." Data extraction was done in duplicate.

P11. [Yes] The extracted variables are listed and defined.

P12. [No] Methods for assessing risk of bias were not described.

P13. [NA] Outcome measures are not summarized since no meta-analysis was performed.

P14. [NA] Synthesis methods are not applicable without a meta-analysis. 

P15. [NA] Assessment of risk of bias across studies is not applicable without a meta-analysis.

P16. [NA] Additional analyses are not applicable without a meta-analysis. 

P17. [No] A flow diagram of study selection was provided but numbers excluded at each stage were not given. 

P18. [Yes] Characteristics of included studies were presented in Tables 1 and 2.

P19. [No] Risk of bias within studies was not presented.

P20. [Yes] Results for outcomes were presented for each study in Table 2. 

P21. [NA] Synthesis of results is not applicable without a meta-analysis.

P22. [NA] Assessment of risk of bias across studies is not applicable without a meta-analysis.

P23. [NA] Additional analyses are not applicable without a meta-analysis.

P24. [Yes] The discussion summarizes the main findings and considers their relevance.

P25. [Yes] Limitations at the study level are discussed.

P26. [Yes] The conclusions provide an interpretation of the results in context of other evidence. 

P27. [No] Sources of funding were not reported.

llm_message:
Here are the AMSTAR and PRISMA assessments for the given systematic review:

A1. "[Yes]"
"Electronic searches restricted to prospective studies with a minimal follow-up of 1 year included MEDLINE, EMBASE and the Cochrane Central Register of Controlled Trials."
The review had predefined eligibility criteria.

A2. "[No]"  
"Data from selected studies were extracted by two authors (RNV and KW)."
There was no mention of duplicate study selection.

A3. "[Yes]"
"For MEDLINE search the following search term was used: ‘(InfantORChildORAdolescent) AND ("inguinal Hernia"OR"processus vaginalis") AND (IncidenceOR"Treatment Outcome"ORRecurrenceORLaparoscopyORcontralateralORSurgeryORExamination) AND (english[Language]ORgerman[Language])’."
At least two databases were searched along with supplementary strategies. 

A4. "[No]"
No mention of including or excluding based on publication status.

A5. "[No]"
No list of included/excluded studies provided.

A6. "[Yes]" 
"In total 1669 children were included. Of this number 1405 (84%) were male and 264 (16%) were female. Nine hundred forty-five (57%) children had right-sided hernia and 545 (33%) children had left-sided hernia at first presentation."
Study characteristics were provided in Table 1.

A7. "[No]"
No mention of assessing study quality.

A8. "[NA]"
No meta-analysis performed.

A9. "[NA]" 
No meta-analysis performed.

A10. "[NA]"
No meta-analysis performed. 

A11. "[NA]"
No meta-analysis performed.

P1. "[Yes]"
"Incidence of metachronous contralateral inguinal hernias in children following unilateral repair — A meta-analysis of prospective studies"
Identified as a systematic review.

P2. "[Yes]" 
Provided structured abstract with background, objectives, eligibility criteria, data sources, synthesis methods, results, conclusions.

P3. "[Yes]"
"The aim of the present meta-analysis study is to systematically appraise the incidence of metachronous contralateral childhood inguinal hernia following unilateral inguinal hernia repair using data from well-designed prospective studies."  
Described rationale for review.

P4. "[Yes]" 
"The primary outcome was the overall incidence of MCIH in children with unilateral inguinal hernia (i)." 
Provided objectives with PICOS elements.

P5. "[No]"
No protocol registration mentioned.

P6. "[Yes]"
"Inclusion criteria consisted of prospective observational studies (a), with minimal follow-up time of one year (b), assessing newborns, infants, children, adolescents and young adults, aged from 0 to 19 years (c), without contralateral groin exploration or laparoscopic closure of CPPV (d)."
Specified eligibility criteria.

P7. "[Yes]" 
Detailed search strategies provided in Appendix 1.

P8. "[Yes]"
Provided full search strategy for MEDLINE in Appendix 1. 

P9. "[No]"
No details on study selection process. 

P10. "[Yes]" 
"Data from selected studies were extracted by two authors (RNV and KW). Extracted data were managed using a preformed Excel data sheet."
Described data extraction by two authors.

P11. "[Yes]" 
"The primary outcome was the overall incidence of MCIH in children with unilateral inguinal hernia (i). Secondary outcomes consisted of incidence of MCIH in male versus female children (ii); in children younger than 1 year of age versus older children (iii); in children with primarily right- versus primarily left-sided inguinal hernia (iv); and in children with open versus cleft versus closed CPPV (v)."
Defined outcomes sought.

P12. "[No]" 
No details on risk of bias assessment.

P13. "[NA]"
No meta-analysis performed.

P14. "[NA]"
No meta-analysis performed.

P15. "[NA]"  
No meta-analysis performed.

P16. "[NA]"
No meta-analysis performed.

P17. "[No]"
No flow diagram of study selection.

P18. "[Yes]"
Provided characteristics of included studies in Table 1.

P19. "[No]"
Did not assess risk of bias in individual studies.

P20. "[Yes]"
Presented summary data and effect estimates for each study in forest plots.

P21. "[NA]" 
No meta-analysis performed.

P22. "[NA]"
No meta-analysis performed. 

P23. "[NA]"
No meta-analysis performed.

P24. "[Yes]"
Summarized main findings and discussed relevance.

P25. "[Yes]" 
Discussed limitations at study and review level.

P26. "[Yes]"
Provided general interpretation of results and implications.

P27. "[Yes]"
Stated no funding received.

llm_message:
Here are the AMSTAR and PRISMA assessments:

A1. "Our search yielded 288 citations, of which 11 (622 patients) met inclusion criteria and were incorporated into the systematic review." "[Yes]" The review had predefined inclusion criteria.

A2. "Title and abstract screening was conducted independently by 2 authors to select all citations that might contain comparisons of interest. Full text of each included article was obtained and data were abstracted independently by 2 authors." "[Yes]" There was duplicate study selection and data extraction.  

A3. "We comprehensively searched the published and unpublished literature between 1990 and 2010. Eligibility criteria were applied." "[Yes]" Multiple databases were searched along with other supplementary methods.

A4. "The authors should state that they searched for reports regardless of their publication type. The authors should state whether or not they excluded any reports (from the systematic review), based on their publication status, language etc." "[No]" Grey literature was not specifically searched or included.

A5. "A list of included and excluded studies should be provided." "[No]" A list of excluded studies was not provided.

A6. "In an aggregated form such as a table, data from the original studies should be provided on the participants, interventions and outcomes." "[Yes]" Table 1 and 2 provide details on participants, interventions, and outcomes.

A7. "Critical appraisal of the included studies was carried out by 2 independent reviewers using a quality assessment instrument adopted from Elyas et al,14 modified to fit the objectives of this study." "[Yes]" The methodological quality of included studies was assessed.

A8. "The results of the methodological rigor and scientific quality should be considered in the analysis and the conclusions of the review, and explicitly stated in formulating recommendations." "[No]" The quality assessment was not incorporated into the analysis or conclusions.

A9. "For the pooled results, a test should be done to ensure the studies were combinable, to assess their homogeneity (i.e., Chi-squared test for homogeneity, I2)." "[NA]" No quantitative synthesis was performed. 

A10. "An assessment of publication bias should include a combination of graphical aids (e.g., funnel plot, other available tests) and/or statistical tests (e.g., Egger regression test, Hedges-Olken)." "[No]" Publication bias was not assessed.

A11. "Potential sources of support should be clearly acknowledged in both the systematic review and the included studies." "[No]" Sources of funding were not reported for the included studies.

P1. "Effect of Preoperative Hormonal Stimulation on Postoperative Complication Rates After Proximal Hypospadias Repair: A Systematic Review" "[Yes]" Identified as a systematic review.

P2. "The abstract provides relevant background, objectives, data sources, eligibility criteria, interventions, results, conclusions and implications." "[Yes]" Structured summary provided.

P3. "Describe the rationale for the review in the context of what is already known." "[Yes]" Introduction describes the rationale.

P4. "Provide an explicit statement of questions being addressed with reference to participants, interventions, comparisons, outcomes, and study design (PICOS)." "[Yes]" Objectives and inclusion criteria outline the PICOS.

P5. "Indicate if a review protocol exists, if and where it can be accessed (e.g., Web address), and, if available, provide registration information including registration number." "[No]" A protocol was not referenced.

P6. "Specify study characteristics (e.g., PICOS, length of follow-up) and report characteristics (e.g., years considered, language, publication status) used as criteria for eligibility, giving rationale." "[Yes]" The eligibility criteria are detailed. 

P7. "Describe all information sources (e.g., databases with dates of coverage, contact with study authors to identify additional studies) in the search and date last searched." "[Yes]" The search methods are described.

P8. "Present full electronic search strategy for at least one database, including any limits used, such that it could be repeated." "[No]" The search strategy was not presented.

P9. "State the process for selecting studies (i.e., screening, eligibility, included in systematic review, and, if applicable, included in the meta-analysis)." "[Yes]" The study selection process is diagrammed and described.

P10. "Describe method of data extraction from reports (e.g., piloted forms, independently, in duplicate) and any processes for obtaining and confirming data from investigators." "[Yes]" Data extraction was done independently and in duplicate. 

P11. "List and define all variables for which data were sought (e.g., PICOS, funding sources) and any assumptions and simplifications made." "[Yes]" Extracted variables are listed in Tables 1 and 2.

P12. "[NA]" No meta-analysis was performed.

P13. "[NA]" No meta-analysis was performed. 

P14. "[NA]" No meta-analysis was performed.

P15. "[NA]" No meta-analysis was performed.

P16. "[NA]" No meta-analysis was performed.

P17. "Give numbers of studies screened, assessed for eligibility, and included in the review, with reasons for exclusions at each stage, ideally with a flow diagram." "[Yes]" The study selection process is diagrammed in Figure 1.

P18. "For each study, present characteristics for which data were extracted (e.g., study size, PICOS, follow-up period) and provide the citations." "[Yes]" Study details are presented in Tables 1 and 2.

P19. "[NA]" No meta-analysis was performed. 

P20. "[NA]" No meta-analysis was performed.

P21. "[NA]" No meta-analysis was performed. 

P22. "[NA]" No meta-analysis was performed.

P23. "[NA]" No meta-analysis was performed.

P24. "Summarize the main findings including the strength of evidence for each main outcome; consider their relevance to key groups (e.g., healthcare providers, users, and policy makers)." "[Yes]" The findings are summarized in the discussion and conclusion.

P25. "Discuss limitations at study and outcome level (e.g., risk of bias), and at review-level (e.g., incomplete retrieval of identified research, reporting bias)." "[Yes]" Limitations are described.

P26. "Provide a general interpretation of the results in the context of other evidence, and implications for future research." "[Yes]" Conclusions are made in context of the current literature.

P27. "Describe sources of funding for the systematic review and other support (e.g., supply of data); role of funders for the systematic review." "[No]" Sources of funding were not reported.

llm_message:
Here are the AMSTAR and PRISMA assessments:

A1. [Yes] "All published studies until July 30, 2010, were searched with the terms laparoscopy, laparoscopic herniorrhaphy, pediatric inguinal hernia, and open herniorrhaphy from Medline (using PubMed as the search engine), Embase, Ovid, Web of Science, and Cochrane databases, without lower date limit."
The review had a comprehensive literature search with no date restrictions.

A2. [No] The review did not mention duplicate study selection or data extraction.

A3. [Yes] "This review was limited to the published studies, and no contact was made with the authors to obtain unpublished data. The citations, abstracts, or full text of all potentially relevant studies were independently evaluated and selected by 3 reviewers (YCL, ZHY, and TQS), and any disagreements were resolved by consensus." 
At least two electronic databases were searched and supplementary search methods were used.

A4. [No] The review did not mention inclusion or exclusion based on publication status. 

A5. [No] The review did not provide a list of included and excluded studies.

A6. [Yes] "Data regarding the following factors were considered: first author, publication date, study method, participant features, intervention characteristics, definition of complications, and outcome measures." Table 1 provides characteristics of the included studies.

A7. [No] The review did not assess study quality.

A8. [NA] The review did not assess study quality (A7).

A9. [Yes] "Statistical heterogeneity was assessed using the I2 statistics. If the I2 value was less than 50%, then a fixed effects meta-analysis was applied; if the I2 value was 50% or more, then the random effects meta-analysis was used."
Appropriate methods were used to combine study findings. 

A10. [No] The review did not assess publication bias.

A11. [No] The review did not report on sources of support or conflict of interest.

P1. [Yes] "Laparoscopic vs open herniorrhaphy in the management of pediatric inguinal hernia: a systemic review and meta-analysis"
Identifies as a systematic review and meta-analysis.

P2. [Yes] The abstract provides a structured summary.

P3. [Yes] The introduction describes the rationale and context. 

P4. [Yes] "The aim of this review was to critique the current literature to determine the efficacy of LH." 
The objectives relate to PICOS.

P5. [No] The review did not mention a protocol or registration.

P6. [Yes] The methods section specifies eligibility criteria.

P7. [Yes] The methods section describes the information sources and date last searched.

P8. [No] The full search strategy was not provided.

P9. [Yes] The methods section describes the study selection process. 

P10. [Yes] "Three reviewers (YCL, ZHY, and TQS) independently assessed selected studies, extracted, and tabulated data from each article with a predefined data extraction form."
The data collection process is described.

P11. [Yes] "Data regarding the following factors were considered: first author, publication date, study method, participant features, intervention characteristics, definition of complications, and outcome measures."
The extracted data items are defined.

P12. [NA] The review did not assess individual study bias (meta-analysis only).

P13. [Yes] "Weighted mean differences (WMDs) and ORs were used for the analysis of continuous and dichotomous variables, respectively."
Summary measures are stated.

P14. [NA] The review did not combine study results (meta-analysis only). 

P15. [NA] The review did not assess risk of bias across studies (meta-analysis only).

P16. [NA] No additional analyses were done (meta-analysis only).

P17. [Yes] Figure 1 shows the study selection flow diagram. 

P18. [Yes] Table 1 provides characteristics of included studies.

P19. [NA] Individual study bias was not assessed (meta-analysis only).

P20. [NA] Individual study results were not presented (meta-analysis only).

P21. [NA] Results of meta-analyses were not presented (meta-analysis only). 

P22. [NA] Risk of bias across studies was not assessed (meta-analysis only).

P23. [NA] No additional analyses were presented (meta-analysis only).

P24. [Yes] The discussion summarizes the main findings and considers their relevance.

P25. [Yes] Limitations at the study and outcome level are discussed.

P26. [Yes] The conclusion provides an overall interpretation of results and implications.

P27. [No] Sources of funding were not reported for the review.

llm_message:
Here are the responses for the AMSTAR and PRISMA items:

A1. [Yes] "The protocol of this review was prospectively published in the PROSPERO registry (CRD42015016745) [13]." This indicates that an a priori design was published.

A2. [Yes] "All of the resulting titles were twice inspected independently; papers were excluded if one of the following exclusion criteria were met: basic science or animal studies, non-comparative studies or case reports, or papers that did not include GS patients." This indicates that there was duplicate study selection. 

A3. [Yes] "Papers with pertinent titles were systematically identified by searching the following sources: AMED, PubMed, MEDLINE, Cochrane, EMBASE, Africa-wide information, Biosys, Global Health, LLAOS, and Web of Science in November 2014 with no date or language restrictions." Searching multiple databases indicates a comprehensive search.

A4. [Yes] "For each of these databases, a search strategy guided by our institution's scientific librarian was established according to the database design (Appendix A). A hand check of reference lists of the included articles was performed to identify any further relevant papers. Gray literature was sought, where appropriate, by probing the abstracts of relevant conferences and contacting the authors for any unpublished results." Searching for gray literature indicates that publication status was not an inclusion criteria.

A5. [No] A list of included and excluded studies is not provided.

A6. [Yes] "The characteristics of the included studies are highlighted in Table 1." Table 1 provides aggregated data on the participants, interventions and outcomes. 

A7. [No] The methodological quality of included studies was assessed using the Newcastle-Ottawa scale, but it is not clear if this was done a priori.

A8. [No] The quality of studies was not incorporated into the analysis or conclusions.

A9. [NA] No quantitative synthesis was performed.

A10. [NA] No assessment of publication bias was performed. 

A11. [No] Sources of support were not reported for the included studies.

P1. [Yes] The title "Flap versus fascial closure for gastroschisis: a systematic review and meta-analysis" identifies the report as a systematic review and meta-analysis.

P2. [Yes] The abstract provides a structured summary including background, objectives, data sources, eligibility criteria, participants, interventions, study appraisal and synthesis methods, results, limitations, and conclusions.

P3. [Yes] The introduction describes the rationale for the review in the context of existing knowledge. 

P4. [Yes] The introduction states "The objective of this investigation was to compare the short-term outcomes of flap closure and fascial closure through a formal systematic literature review and meta-analysis." This provides the objectives and specifies the participants, interventions, comparisons, and outcomes.

P5. [Yes] The methods state "The protocol of this review was prospectively published in the PROSPERO registry (CRD42015016745) [13]." This indicates a protocol was registered. 

P6. [Yes] The methods describe the eligibility criteria using PICOS and characteristics such as years considered and language.

P7. [Yes] The methods list the databases searched and date last searched.

P8. [Yes] Appendix A provides the full search strategy for PubMed.

P9. [Yes] The results section describes the study screening, eligibility, and inclusion process, including reasons for exclusion, in a flow diagram. 

P10. [No] The process for data collection is not described.

P11. [No] Variables for which data were sought are not listed.

P12. [No] Methods for assessing risk of bias are not described at the outcome level.

P13. [NA] No quantitative synthesis was performed.

P14. [NA] No quantitative synthesis was performed. 

P15. [NA] No assessment of bias across studies was performed.

P16. [NA] No additional analyses were performed.

P17. [Yes] The flow diagram provides numbers of studies screened, assessed for eligibility, and included, with reasons for exclusions.

P18. [Yes] Table 1 presents relevant characteristics of the included studies. 

P19. [No] Risk of bias within studies is not presented.

P20. [NA] No meta-analysis was performed.

P21. [NA] No meta-analysis was performed.

P22. [NA] No assessment of bias across studies was performed. 

P23. [NA] No additional analyses were performed.

P24. [Yes] The discussion summarizes the main findings and considers their relevance.

P25. [Yes] The discussion describes limitations at the study and outcome level.

P26. [Yes] The conclusion provides an overall interpretation of results and implications for future research.

P27. [Yes] The funding sources are described.

llm_message:
Here are the AMSTAR and PRISMA assessments:

A1. Was an 'a priori' design provided? 
"[No]"
No protocol or pre-determined objectives are mentioned.

A2. Was there duplicate study selection and data extraction?
"[No]" 
No mention of duplicate study selection or data extraction.

A3. Was a comprehensive literature search performed?
"[Yes]"
"Scientific databases (PubMed, Medline, OVID, ERIC, and Cochrane Collaboration) were searched"
Performs search of at least 2 databases plus supplementary strategies.

A4. Was the status of publication (i.e. grey literature) used as an inclusion criterion?  
"[No]"
Does not mention searching for or including grey literature.

A5. Was a list of studies (included and excluded) provided?
"[No]" 
Does not provide a list of included/excluded studies.

A6. Were the characteristics of the included studies provided?
"[Yes]" 
Provides characteristics of included studies in Table II.

A7. Was the scientific quality of the included studies assessed and documented?
"[No]"
Does not mention assessing quality of included studies.

A8. Was the scientific quality of the included studies used appropriately in formulating conclusions?
"[NA]"
Since quality of studies was not assessed, this item is not applicable.

A9. Were the methods used to combine the findings of studies appropriate?  
"[NA]"
No quantitative synthesis performed.

A10. Was the likelihood of publication bias assessed?
"[No]"
Does not assess publication bias.

A11. Was the conflict of interest included?
"[No]"
Does not report on conflicts of interest.

P1. Identify the report as a systematic review, meta-analysis, or both.
"[Yes]"
"Herein, we compare the postoperative pain in children who underwent SIPES or standard laparoscopy (SL)."

P2. Structured summary 
"[No]"
Does not contain a structured abstract.

P3. Describe rationale for review in context of what is already known.
"[Yes]"
"It has been speculated that single incision pediatric endoscopic surgery (SIPES) in children could result in more postoperative pain given the device size for a child umbilicus."

P4. Provide explicit statement of questions being addressed.
"[Yes]"
"The aim of our study was to investigate whether children who underwent SIPES suffer from greater postoperative pain than those who underwent SL."

P5. Indicate if protocol exists and provide registration information.
"[No]"
Does not mention if a protocol exists.

P6. Specify study characteristics used as criteria for eligibility.
"[No]"
Does not describe eligibility criteria.

P7. Describe information sources, search strategy, and dates.
"[Yes]" 
"Scientific databases (PubMed, Medline, OVID, ERIC, and Cochrane Collaboration) were searched using the keywords “single port surgery” and “child”. Only comparative articles that were published between January 2008 and November 2012 and that analysed postoperative pain following SIPES or SL in children were included."

P8. Present full electronic search strategy for at least one database.
"[No]"
Search strategy not provided.

P9. State process for selecting studies.
"[No]"
Selection process not described.

P10. Describe method of data extraction and confirmation. 
"[No]"
Data extraction process not described.

P11. List and define all variables for which data were sought.
"[No]"
Does not list or define data extraction variables.

P12. Describe methods for assessing risk of bias in individual studies.
"[No]" 
Does not describe assessing risk of bias.

P13. State principal summary measures.
"[NA]"
No quantitative synthesis performed.

P14. Describe methods of handling data and combining results.
"[NA]"
No quantitative synthesis performed.

P15. Specify any assessment of risk of bias across studies.
"[NA]"
No quantitative synthesis performed.

P16. Describe methods of additional analyses.
"[NA]"
No additional analyses performed.

P17. Provide numbers of studies screened, assessed, and included, ideally with a flow diagram. 
"[No]"
Does not provide number of studies at each stage or a flow diagram.

P18. For each study, present characteristics and provide citations.
"[Yes]"
Provides characteristics for each included study in Table II and cites studies in text.

P19. Present data on risk of bias for each study. 
"[No]"
Does not present risk of bias results.

P20. For each study, present simple summary data for each intervention group.
"[No]"
Does not present summary data for each study.

P21. Present results of meta-analyses, including confidence intervals and measures of consistency.
"[NA]" 
No meta-analysis performed.

P22. Present results of risk of bias across studies.
"[NA]"
No assessment of risk of bias across studies.

P23. Give results of additional analyses.
"[NA]"
No additional analyses performed. 

P24. Summarize main findings and discuss relevance to key groups.
"[Yes]"
"In conclusion, the present study suggests that single port laparoscopic surgery in children is feasible, safe and associated with a similar postoperative pain to standard laparoscopy."

P25. Discuss limitations at study and outcome level and at review level.
"[No]"
Does not discuss limitations.

P26. Provide general interpretation of results in context of other evidence.
"[Yes]" 
"Our findings were confirmed by other studies in the literature (Table II). According to our systematic review, most of the studies showed no difference or even an advantage of SIPES over SL for postoperative pain."

P27. Describe sources of funding and role of funders.
"[No]"
Does not describe sources of funding.

llm_message:
Here are the assessments for the AMSTAR and PRISMA items:

A1. Was an 'a priori' design provided? 
[Yes]
"An electronic search was performed using EMBASE, PubMed, MEDLINE from 2000 to 2014."
The review had predefined objectives and criteria.

A2. Was there duplicate study selection and data extraction?
[No] 
"Two authors independently extracted data from the list of the included studies, and a third reviewer was required for a final decision in the case of any discrepancies."
Only two reviewers performed study selection and data extraction.

A3. Was a comprehensive literature search performed?
[Yes]
"An electronic search was performed using EMBASE, PubMed, MEDLINE from 2000 to 2014. The search terms single-incision, transumbilical, three-port, conventional, laparoscopic surgery, children and appendectomy were used individually and in combination."
At least two databases were searched along with supplementary strategies. 

A4. Was the status of publication used as an inclusion criterion?
[No]
The review did not mention searching for or including grey literature.

A5. Was a list of studies (included and excluded) provided?
[No]
A list of included studies was provided in Table 1, but no list of excluded studies.

A6. Were the characteristics of the included studies provided?
[Yes] 
"Table 1 outlines basic demographic data from each included study, including study style, male:female sex ratio and BMI (kg/m2) or weight (kg) in each group."

A7. Was the scientific quality of the included studies assessed and documented?
[No]
The quality of included studies was not assessed.

A8. Was the scientific quality of the included studies used appropriately in formulating conclusions?
[NA]
Study quality was not assessed.

A9. Were the methods used to combine the findings of studies appropriate?  
[Yes]
"For continuous variables, we calculated mean differences (MDs) with 95 % confidence intervals (CIs). For dichotomous variables, we used odds ratios (ORs). Statistical Heterogeneity was assessed using the Chi square test with significance set at P < 0.10."
Appropriate methods were used in the meta-analyses.

A10. Was the likelihood of publication bias assessed?
[No]
Publication bias was not assessed.

A11. Was the conflict of interest included?
[No]
Conflicts of interest were not reported.

P1. Identify the report as a systematic review, meta-analysis, or both.
[Yes]
"Single-incision versus conventional laparoscopic appendicectomy in children: a systematic review and meta-analysis"

P2. Provide a structured summary.
[Yes]
The abstract provides a structured summary.

P3. Describe the rationale for the review.  
[Yes] 
"Although SILA demonstrates some potential advantages over CLA and open appendectomy, some surgeons do not approve this surgical approach. Furthermore, considerable argument still exists regarding the real benefits of SILA over CLA in pediatric patients."

P4. Provide objectives with PICOS.
[No] 
Objectives are not stated with PICOS.

P5. Indicate if a review protocol exists and provide registration information.
[No]
A protocol is not mentioned.

P6. Specify study characteristics and report characteristics.
[Yes]
Inclusion and exclusion criteria specify study characteristics. 

P7. Describe information sources including dates of coverage.
[Yes]
"An electronic search was performed using EMBASE, PubMed, MEDLINE from 2000 to 2014."

P8. Present full electronic search strategy.
[No]
The full search strategy is not presented.

P9. Describe study selection process. 
[Yes]
"Two authors independently extracted data from the list of the included studies, and a third reviewer was required for a final decision in the case of any discrepancies."

P10. Describe data collection process.
[No] 
The data extraction process is not described in detail.

P11. List and define variables extracted.
[No]
The extracted variables are not defined.

P12. Describe methods for assessing risk of bias.
[No]
Risk of bias methods are not described.

P13. State principal summary measures.
[Yes]
"For continuous variables, we calculated mean differences (MDs) with 95% confidence intervals (CIs). For dichotomous variables, we used odds ratios (ORs)."

P14. Describe synthesis methods.
[Yes] 
"Statistical Heterogeneity was assessed using the Chi square test with significance set at P < 0.10. If the I2 value was less than 50%, a fixed-effects approach was applied; if the I2 value was 50% or more, then a random-effects approach instead of a fixed-effect analysis would be undertaken [6]."

P15. Specify assessment of risk of bias across studies.
[NA]
No assessment of risk of bias across studies was performed.

P16. Describe additional analyses.
[NA]
No additional analyses were performed. 

P17. Provide study selection flow diagram. 
[Yes]
Figure 1 shows the study selection flow diagram.

P18. Present study characteristics.
[Yes]
Table 1 presents characteristics of the included studies.

P19. Present risk of bias assessment.
[No]
Risk of bias was not assessed for individual studies.

P20. Present results for each study. 
[Yes] 
Table 2 displays the results for each study.

P21. Present results of syntheses.
[Yes] 
Results of the meta-analyses are presented in forest plots.

P22. Present risk of bias across studies.
[NA]
Risk of bias across studies was not assessed.

P23. Present additional analyses. 
[NA]
No additional analyses were performed.

P24. Summarize evidence.
[Yes]
"Our study suggests that SILA is a feasible and safe surgical procedure alternative to CLA for pediatric patients with appendicitis."

P25. Discuss limitations from study level to review level.
[Yes] 
Limitations at the study and review level are discussed.

P26. Provide general interpretation of results.
[Yes]
"In conclusion, our study suggests that SILA is a feasible and safe surgical procedure alternative to CLA for pediatric patients with appendicitis." 

P27. Describe sources of funding and role of funders.
[No]
Sources of funding are not reported.

llm_message:
Here are the assessments for the AMSTAR and PRISMA items:

A1. Was an 'a priori' design provided? 
"The research question and inclusion criteria should be established before the conduct of the review."
[Yes]
The introduction states the rationale and objectives clearly.

A2. Was there duplicate study selection and data extraction?
"There should be at least two independent data extractors and a consensus procedure for disagreements should be in place."  
[No]
The methods do not mention duplicate study selection or data extraction.

A3. Was a comprehensive literature search performed?
"At least two electronic sources should be searched. The report must include years and databases used (e.g., Central, EMBASE, and MEDLINE)."
[Yes]
The methods state: "These reports were obtained from a Medline search for all publications regarding EDT in the pediatric population for the past 40 year using the keywords “thoracotomy”, “emergency”, “trauma”, “resuscitation”, “pediatrics”, and “children”."

A4. Was the status of publication (i.e. grey literature) used as an inclusion criterion?
"The authors should state that they searched for reports regardless of their publication type."
[No] 
Grey literature was not mentioned.

A5. Was a list of studies (included and excluded) provided?
"A list of included and excluded studies should be provided."
[No]
No lists of included or excluded studies were provided.

A6. Were the characteristics of the included studies provided? 
"In an aggregated form such as a table, data from the original studies should be provided on the participants, interventions and outcomes."
[Yes]
Table 1 provides aggregated data on the included studies. 

A7. Was the scientific quality of the included studies assessed and documented?
"‘A priori’ methods of assessment should be provided (e.g., for effectiveness studies if the author(s) chose to include only randomized, double-blind, placebo controlled studies, or allocation concealment as inclusion criteria)." 
[No]
The quality of included studies was not assessed.

A8. Was the scientific quality of the included studies used appropriately in formulating conclusions?
"The results of the methodological rigor and scientific quality should be considered in the analysis and the conclusions of the review, and explicitly stated in formulating recommendations."
[NA] 
The quality of studies was not assessed (A7).

A9. Were the methods used to combine the findings of studies appropriate?  
"For the pooled results, a test should be done to ensure the studies were combinable, to assess their homogeneity (i.e., Chi-squared test for homogeneity, I2)."
[NA]
The results were not combined quantitatively.

A10. Was the likelihood of publication bias assessed?
"An assessment of publication bias should include a combination of graphical aids (e.g., funnel plot, other available tests) and/or statistical tests (e.g., Egger regression test, Hedges-Olken)." 
[No]
Publication bias was not assessed.

A11. Was the conflict of interest included?
"Potential sources of support should be clearly acknowledged in both the systematic review and the included studies."
[No]
Conflicts of interest were not reported.

P1. Identify the report as a systematic review, meta-analysis, or both. 
[Yes]
The title states "systematic review".

P2. Provide a structured summary.
[Yes] 
The abstract provides a structured summary.

P3. Describe the rationale for the review. 
[Yes]
The introduction describes the rationale.

P4. Provide an explicit statement of questions being addressed.
[Yes]
The introduction states: "we reviewed our experience at a level 1 trauma center and report the largest analysis over the past 25 years. In conjunction, we performed a systematic review of all published reports regarding pediatric EDT to help identify the factors associated with morbidity and mortality."

P5. Indicate if a review protocol exists and provide registration information.
[No]
A protocol was not mentioned. 

P6. Specify study characteristics and report characteristics.
[Yes]
The methods describe the study selection criteria. 

P7. Describe information sources and dates last searched.
[Yes] 
The methods state: "These reports were obtained from a Medline search for all publications regarding EDT in the pediatric population for the past 40 year using the keywords “thoracotomy”, “emergency”, “trauma”, “resuscitation”, “pediatrics”, and “children”."

P8. Present full electronic search strategy. 
[No]
The full search strategy was not presented.

P9. State the process for selecting studies.
[Yes]
The methods describe the study selection process.

P10. Describe method of data extraction.
[No] 
The data extraction process was not described.

P11. List and define all variables for which data were sought.
[Yes]
Table 4 lists the variables that were extracted.

P12. Describe methods for assessing risk of bias. 
[NA]
Risk of bias was not assessed.

P13. State the principal summary measures.
[NA] 
Quantitative synthesis was not done. 

P14. Describe the methods of handling data and combining results.
[NA]
Quantitative synthesis was not done.

P15. Specify any assessment of risk of bias across studies.
[NA]
Risk of bias across studies was not assessed.

P16. Describe methods of additional analyses.
[NA]
No additional analyses were done.

P17. Give numbers of studies screened, assessed, and included, with reasons for exclusions. 
[No]
The number of studies screened and excluded was not provided.

P18. For each study, present characteristics and provide citations.
[Yes]
Table 1 provides aggregated characteristics and citations for each included study.

P19. Present data on risk of bias for each study. 
[NA] 
Risk of bias was not assessed.

P20. For each study, present simple summary data for each intervention group, effect estimates, and confidence intervals.
[No]
Outcome data for each study was not presented. 

P21. Present results of each meta-analysis, including confidence intervals and measures of consistency. 
[NA]
No meta-analysis was done.

P22. Present results of any assessment of risk of bias across studies.
[NA] 
Risk of bias across studies was not assessed.

P23. Give results of additional analyses.
[NA]
No additional analyses were done. 

P24. Summarize the main findings and discuss relevance to key groups.
[Yes] 
The discussion summarizes the main findings and their relevance.

P25. Discuss limitations at study and outcome level and at review level.
[Yes]
The discussion describes limitations at the study and review level.

P26. Provide a general interpretation of results in context of other evidence.
[Yes]
The discussion interprets the findings in the context of other evidence.

P27. Describe sources of funding and role of funders.
[No]
Sources of funding were not reported.

A11. [No] Conflicts of interest were not reported for the included studies.

Here are the relevant quotes, explanations, and responses for each AMSTAR and PRISMA item:

A1. Was an 'a priori' design provided? 
Quotes: "The research question and inclusion criteria should be established before the conduct of the review."
Explanation: The review states that inclusion criteria should be pre-determined.
[Yes]

A2. Was there duplicate study selection and data extraction?
Quotes: "There should be at least two independent data extractors and a consensus procedure for disagreements should be in place."
Explanation: The review does not mention duplicate study selection or data extraction.
[No]

A3. Was a comprehensive literature search performed?
Quotes: "At least two electronic sources should be searched." "All searches should be supplemented by" [...] "reviewing the references in the studies found."
Explanation: The review searched Medline, Embase, Web of Science, and references of included studies. 
[Yes]

A4. Was the status of publication used as an inclusion criterion?
Quotes: N/A
Explanation: Grey literature was not discussed.
[No]

A5. Was a list of studies (included and excluded) provided?
Quotes: N/A
Explanation: A list of included/excluded studies was not provided.
[No] 

A6. Were the characteristics of the included studies provided?
Quotes: "In an aggregated form such as a table, data from the original studies should be provided on the participants, interventions and outcomes." 
Explanation: Tables 1 and 2 provide characteristics of included studies.
[Yes]

A7. Was the scientific quality of the included studies assessed and documented?
Quotes: N/A
Explanation: The quality of included studies was not assessed.
[No]

A8. Was the scientific quality of the included studies used appropriately in formulating conclusions? 
Quotes: N/A
Explanation: Study quality was not assessed.
[NA]

[NA]

Explanation: Publication bias was not assessed.
[No]

Explanation: Conflicts of interest were not reported.
[No]

P1. Identify the report as a systematic review, meta-analysis, or both.
Quotes: "Title: Management of Recurrent Tracheoesophageal Fistulas: A Systematic Review"
Explanation: The title identifies the report as a systematic review.
[Yes]

P2. Structured summary.
Quotes: N/A
Explanation: No structured abstract provided.
[No]

P3. Describe the rationale for the review. 
Quotes: "The management of a recurrent tracheoesophageal fistula (RTEF) includes either open surgery (OS) or an endoscopic treatment (ET); the ideal option is unclear. We aim to comparatively review all published treatment options, and outcomes, for managing RTEF."
Explanation: Provides background and rationale.
[Yes]

P4. Provide objectives with PICOS.
Quotes: N/A
Explanation: Does not explicitly state PICOS objectives.

Explanation: Does not describe eligibility criteria.
[No]

Quotes: "A Medline, Embase, and web of science searches were performed using the keywords recurrent tracheoesophageal fistula. The index of all issues of the European Journal of Pediatric Surgery, Journal of Pediatric Surgery, Pediatric Surgery International, and the International Journal of Pediatric Otorhinolaryngology was searched for relevant articles; the reference list of all relevant articles was also searched."
Explanation: Describes sources searched.
[Yes]

P8. Present search strategy. 
Quotes: N/A
Explanation: Does not provide full search strategy.
[No]

P9. State process for selection studies.

Explanation: Does not describe study selection process.

Explanation: Does not describe data extraction process.
[No]

P11. List and define data items sought.

Explanation: Does not list or define data sought.
[No]

P12. Assess risk of bias in individual studies.
Quotes: N/A
Explanation: Does not assess risk of bias.
[No]

P13. State principal summary measures.
Quotes: N/A
Explanation: No quantitative synthesis performed.
[NA]

P14. Synthesis of results.
Quotes: N/A
Explanation: No quantitative synthesis performed.
[NA]

Explanation: No assessment of risk of bias across studies.  
[NA]

Explanation: No additional analyses performed.
[NA]

Quotes: N/A
Explanation: Does not report number of studies at each stage.
[No]

P18. Present study characteristics.
Quotes: "Tables 1 and 2 provide characteristics of included studies."
Explanation: Provides some characteristics in tables.
[Yes]

P19. Present risk of bias within studies. 
Quotes: N/A
Explanation: Does not assess risk of bias within studies.
[No]

P20. Results of individual studies.
Quotes: N/A 
Explanation: Does not provide results for each study.
[No]

P21. Present results of syntheses.
Quotes: N/A
Explanation: No quantitative syntheses performed.
[NA]

P22. Present risk of bias across studies.
Quotes: N/A
Explanation: Did not assess risk of bias across studies.
[NA]

P23. Give additional analyses.
Quotes: N/A
Explanation: No additional analyses performed.
[NA]

P24. Summarize evidence.
Quotes: "In conclusion, based on our findings on 165 published cases, OS for the repair of recurrent TEF has a low morbidity, mortality, and re-fistulation rate particularly when an interposition tissue is placed between the trachea and esophagus. We recommend OS as the treatment of choice when faced with a recurrent TEF."
Explanation: Summarizes main findings and conclusions.
[Yes]

P25. Discuss limitations.
Quotes: N/A
Explanation: Does not discuss limitations.
[No] 

P26. Provide general interpretation.
Quotes: "In conclusion, based on our findings on 165 published cases, OS for the repair of recurrent TEF has a low morbidity, mortality, and re-fistulation rate particularly when an interposition tissue is placed between the trachea and esophagus. We recommend OS as the treatment of choice when faced with a recurrent TEF. Endoscopic treatments are a viable alternative in experienced centers with selected cases. Treatment failures after ETs should be anticipated and a systematic approach to the follow-up of these patients is required to promptly diagnose re-fistulation."
Explanation: Provides interpretation of results.
[Yes]

P27. Describe sources of funding.
Quotes: N/A
Explanation: Does not describe sources of funding.
[No]

"[We reviewed studies published between 1990 and December 2009, searching for “hypospadias” in MEDLINE®/PubMed®, EMBASE®, Web of Science® and the Cochrane Library.]"
The review had predefined inclusion criteria based on searching for studies on "hypospadias" within a specified timeframe. [Yes]

A2. Was there duplicate study selection and data extraction?
"[Three doctors reviewed the abstracts. Articles relevant to the topic of the review were selected by consensus.]"
Multiple reviewers were involved in study selection. [Yes]

"[We reviewed studies published between 1990 and December 2009, searching for “hypospadias” in MEDLINE®/PubMed®, EMBASE®, Web of Science® and the Cochrane Library.]"

- "Original articles published from 1998 to 2012 were searched from Medline, Embase, and Cochrane databases and the Cochrane Controlled Trials Register using different combinations of the following terms: “Hirschsprung's disease,” “transanal,” “perineal approach,” “transabdominal” and “pull-through.”"
- The review had predefined inclusion criteria.
- [Yes]

A2. Was there duplicate study selection and data extraction?

- There were at least 2 independent data extractors.
- [Yes]

A3. Was a comprehensive literature search performed?
- "We searched all publications from August 1998 to March 2012 in the MEDLINE, EMBASE and Cochrane library databases and the Cochrane Controlled Trials Register using different combinations of the following terms: “Hirschsprung's disease,” “transanal,” “perineal approach,” “transabdominal” and “pull-through.” The reference lists of the full articles were also manually searched to identify additional eligible studies."
- At least 2 databases were searched along with supplementary methods.
- [Yes]

- No mention of searching for grey literature.

Two authors independently performed study selection and data extraction. [Yes]

A1. Was an 'a priori' design provided? 
"[Yes]"
Quotes: "The study protocol was registered on the PROSPERO international prospective database of systematic reviews (CRD42013003971)."

A2. Was there duplicate study selection and data extraction?
"[No]"  
Quotes: None.
Reasoning: Duplication of study selection and data extraction is not mentioned. 

A3. Was a comprehensive literature search performed?
"[Yes]"
Quotes: "Systematic literature searches were undertaken of PubMed and EMBASE electronic databases using the following search strategy" [...] ""
Reasoning: At least two databases were searched.

A4. Was the status of publication used as an inclusion criterion?
"[No]"
Quotes: None.  
Reasoning: No mention of including or excluding studies based on publication status.

A5. Was a list of studies (included and excluded) provided?
"[No]" 
Quotes: None.
Reasoning: A list of excluded studies is not provided.

A6. Were the characteristics of the included studies provided?
"[Yes]" 
Quotes: "Six studies met inclusion criteria, involving 135 robot-assisted and 162 conventional laparoscopic fundoplication procedures (Tables 1–2)"
Reasoning: Characteristics of included studies are provided in Tables 1-2.

A7. Was the scientific quality of the included studies assessed and documented?
"[Yes]"
Quotes: "The methodological quality of studies was appraised using a star-based modified Newcastle-Ottawa Scale (mNOS) that considers patient selection, inter-group comparability, and outcome assessment (maximum 3, 10, and 2 stars respectively; total/15)"
Reasoning: The mNOS scale was used to assess study quality. 

A8. Was the scientific quality of the included studies used appropriately in formulating conclusions?  
"[Yes]" 
Quotes: "The strength of this meta-analysis is therefore limited by inherent vulnerability of these study designs to multiple sources of bias and both known and unknown confounders."
Reasoning: Study limitations are acknowledged.

A9. Were the methods used to combine the findings of studies appropriate?
"[NA]"
Quotes: None.
Reasoning: No quantitative data synthesis performed.

Reasoning: No assessment of publication bias without a meta-analysis.

"[No]"
Quotes: None.  
Reasoning: No mention of conflicts of interest.

P1. Identify as systematic review in title.
"[Yes]"  
Quotes: "Meta analysis of robot-assisted versus conventional laparoscopic fundoplication in children"
Reasoning: Identified as meta-analysis in title.

P2. Structured summary.
"[Yes]"
Quotes: "Abstract / Structured summary: Provide a structured summary including, as applicable: background; objectives; data sources; study eligibility criteria, participants, and interventions; study appraisal and synthesis methods; results; limitations; conclusions and implications of key findings; systematic review registration number."
Reasoning: Structured abstract provided.

P3. Describe rationale for review. 
"[Yes]"
Quotes: "The role of robotic surgery in this setting remains unclear, generating a growing sentiment of polarized opinion amongst the surgical community, which is without a well-defined evidence base. The aim of this study is to critically appraise the literature comparing robot-assisted versus conventional laparoscopic MIS for fundoplication in order to further elucidate the comparative safety and efficacy of these techniques."
Reasoning: Rationale described.

P4. Provide objectives with PICOS.
"[Yes]" 
Quotes: "Primary outcome measures of interest were intra-operative conversions, intra-operative complications, length of hospital stay (LOS), post-operative complications, operating time (OT), analgesia requirement and cost."
Reasoning: Outcomes of interest specified.

P5. Indicate protocol registration. 
"[Yes]"
Quotes: "The study protocol was registered on the PROSPERO international prospective database of systematic reviews (CRD42013003971)." 
Reasoning: Registration number and database provided.

P6. Specify eligibility criteria.
"[Yes]" 
Quotes: "All included studies satisfied the following criteria: 1) comparing robot-assisted (RF) versus conventional laparoscopic fundoplication (LF), 2) involving pediatric patients with mean or median study group ages b 18 years, 3) reporting ≥ 5 patients in each study group, and 4) investigating either objective clinical outcome measures or GERD symptoms via standardized questionnaires."
Reasoning: Eligibility criteria described.

P7. Describe information sources.
"[Yes]"
Quotes: "Systematic literature searches were undertaken of PubMed and EMBASE electronic databases using the following search strategy" [...] "" 
Reasoning: Databases and search strategy provided.

P8. Present full search strategy.
"[Yes]"
Quotes: "Systematic literature searches were undertaken of PubMed and EMBASE electronic databases using the following search strategy" [...] ""
Reasoning: Search strategy provided.

P9. State process for study selection.
"[No]" 
Quotes: None.
Reasoning: Study selection process not described.

P10. Describe data collection process. 
"[No]"
Quotes: None.
Reasoning: Data extraction process not described. 

P11. List and define data items sought.
"[Yes]"  
Quotes: "Primary outcome measures of interest were intra-operative conversions, intra-operative complications, length of hospital stay (LOS), post-operative complications, operating time (OT), analgesia requirement and cost."
Reasoning: Outcomes of interest defined.

P12. Assess risk of bias in individual studies. 
"[Yes]" 
Quotes: "The methodological quality of studies was appraised using a star-based modified Newcastle-Ottawa Scale (mNOS) that considers patient selection, inter-group comparability, and outcome assessment (maximum 3, 10, and 2 stars respectively; total/15)"
Reasoning: Risk of bias assessed with mNOS scale.

P13. State principal summary measures.  
"[Yes]" 
Quotes: "Pooled odds ratios (OR) were calculated as the summary statistic for dichotomous variables and weighted mean difference (WMD) calculated for continuous variables."
Reasoning: Summary measures described.

P14. Synthesis methods.
"[NA]"
Quotes: None. 
Reasoning: No meta-analysis performed.

P15. Risk of bias across studies.
"[NA]"
Quotes: None.
Reasoning: No assessment of risk of bias across studies without meta-analysis.

P16. Additional analyses. 
"[NA]" 
Quotes: None.
Reasoning: No additional analyses without meta-analysis.

P17. Study selection results.
"[Yes]" 
Quotes: "Six studies met inclusion criteria, involving 135 robot-assisted and 162 conventional laparoscopic fundoplication procedures (Tables 1–2)"
Reasoning: Number of studies included reported. 

P18. Study characteristics. 
"[Yes]"
Quotes: "Six studies met inclusion criteria, involving 135 robot-assisted and 162 conventional laparoscopic fundoplication procedures (Tables 1–2)"
Reasoning: Study characteristics provided in Tables 1-2.

P19. Risk of bias within studies.
"[Yes]"
Quotes: "The methodological quality of studies was appraised using a star-based modified Newcastle-Ottawa Scale (mNOS) that considers patient selection, inter-group comparability, and outcome assessment (maximum 3, 10, and 2 stars respectively; total/15)"
Reasoning: Risk of bias assessed with mNOS scale.

P20. Results of individual studies.
"[Yes]"
Quotes: "In the RF group, reasons for conversions were due to intraoperative hypotension and arrhythmia (n = 1) [13], technical difficulty in a re-do case (n = 1) [13], and unclear anatomy associated with a hiatus hernia (n = 1) [11]. In the LF group, reasons for conversion were due to gastric perforation (n = 1) [13], incidental discovery of a Morgagni hernia (n = 1) [12], “instrument problems” (n = 1) [12], and technical difficulty in re-do cases (n = 2) [11]."
Reasoning: Results for individual studies provided.

P21. Synthesis of results.
"[NA]"  
Quotes: None.
Reasoning: No meta-analysis performed.

P22. Risk of bias across studies.  
"[NA]"
Quotes: None.
Reasoning: No assessment of risk of bias across studies without meta-analysis. 

P23. Additional analysis.
"[NA]"
Quotes: None.
Reasoning: No additional analyses without meta-analysis.

P24. Summary of evidence.
"[Yes]" 
Quotes: "This meta-analysis has identified no significant difference between robot-assisted and conventional laparoscopic fundoplication for short-term outcomes of intra-operative conversion, length of hospital stay, post-operative complications and total operating time." 
Reasoning: Main findings summarized.

P25. Limitations. 
"[Yes]"
Quotes: "The strength of this meta-analysis is therefore limited by inherent vulnerability of these study designs to multiple sources of bias and both known and unknown confounders. Many important outcome variables also remain unaccounted for in the literature."
Reasoning: Limitations discussed.

P26. Conclusions.
"[Yes]"
Quotes: "In conclusion, meta-analysis of the current literature identifies comparable safety and short-term efficacy for robot-assisted laparoscopic fundoplication when compared to conventional laparoscopic fundoplication in children."
Reasoning: Conclusions provided.

P27. Funding.
"[No]"
Quotes: None.
Reasoning: No mention of funding sources.

llm_message:
Here are the AMSTAR and PRISMA assessments:

A1. [Yes] "The publications were identified by searching the major medical databases such as MEDLINE, EMBASE, and Cochrane Library for relevant papers published between January 1992 and July 2012." The review had an a priori design with predefined objectives, eligibility criteria, and information sources.

A2. [No] The review did not mention duplicate study selection and data extraction.

A3. [Yes] "At least two electronic sources should be searched. The report must include years and databases used (e.g., Central, EMBASE, and MEDLINE)." The review searched multiple electronic databases. 

A4. [No] The review did not state whether grey literature was searched.

A5. [No] The review did not provide a list of included and excluded studies.
