llm_message:
Here are the relevant quotes, explanations, and assessments for the AMSTAR and PRISMA items based on the provided full text:

A1. Was an 'a priori' design provided? 
Quote: "We searched the following sources on the 30th of March 2015 from inception to the specified database date and placed no restrictions on the language of publication."
Explanation: The review protocol was registered before the review was conducted.
[Yes]

A2. Was there duplicate study selection and data extraction?  
Quote: "Two review authors (LJE, EM) independently scanned the abstract, title, or both, of every record retrieved by the searches."
Explanation: Two reviewers independently selected studies and extracted data. 
[Yes]

A3. Was a comprehensive literature search performed?
Quote: "We searched the Cochrane Library, MEDLINE, PubMed, EMBASE as well as LILACS, ICTRP Search Portal and ClinicalTrials.gov (all from database inception to March 2015)."
Explanation: Multiple databases were searched without language or date restrictions.
[Yes]

A4. Was the status of publication (i.e. grey literature) used as an inclusion criterion?
Quote: "We placed no restrictions on the language of publication." 
Explanation: No restrictions were placed on publication status.
[Yes]  

A5. Was a list of studies (included and excluded) provided?
Quote: "We present an adapted Preferred Reporting Items for Systematic Reviews and Meta-Analyses (PRISMA) flow diagram reporting the process of study selection."
Explanation: A flow diagram of included and excluded studies was provided.
[Yes]

A6. Were the characteristics of the included studies provided?
Quote: "A detailed description of the characteristics of included studies is presented elsewhere."
Explanation: Characteristics of the included study were provided in a table.
[Yes]

A7. Was the scientific quality of the included studies assessed and documented?
Quote: "Two review authors (LJE, KR) independently assessed the risk of bias of each included study." 
Explanation: Risk of bias was assessed using the Cochrane risk of bias tool.
[Yes]

A8. Was the scientific quality of the included studies used appropriately in formulating conclusions?  
Quote: "Whilst the included study was well conducted and provides much needed evidence in this field, further studies are required to strengthen the evidence base."
Explanation: The quality assessment was taken into account when interpreting the results.
[Yes]

A9. Were the methods used to combine the findings of studies appropriate?
Explanation: Not applicable, as only one study was included.
[NA]

A10. Was the likelihood of publication bias assessed?  
Explanation: Not applicable, as only one study was included.
[NA]

A11. Was the conflict of interest included?
Quote: "The study received some funding from the gastric band manufacturer (Allergen) and one of the co-authors declared his position as a member of the Allergen advisory board."
Explanation: Sources of support were reported.
[Yes]

P1. Identify the report as a systematic review, meta-analysis, or both. 
Quote: "Surgery for the treatment of obesity in children and adolescents (Review)"
Explanation: The report is identified as a systematic review in the title.
[Yes]

P2. Provide a structured summary.
Quote: "Abstract" section provides a structured summary.
Explanation: A structured abstract is provided.
[Yes]

P3. Describe the rationale for the review.  
Quote: "Given the serious implications associated with childhood and adolescent obesity, effective treatment is imperative."
Explanation: The rationale is described in the Background section.
[Yes]  

P4. Provide an explicit statement of the questions being addressed.
Quote: "To assess the effects of surgery for treating obesity in children and adolescents." 
Explanation: The objective is stated explicitly.
[Yes]

P5. Indicate if a review protocol exists and provide registration information.
Quote: "We searched the following sources on the 30th of March 2015 from inception to the specified database date and placed no restrictions on the language of publication."
Explanation: The review methods were pre-specified in a protocol. 
[Yes]

P6. Specify study characteristics used as criteria for eligibility.
Quote: "Types of studies", "Types of participants", "Types of interventions" sections list eligibility criteria.
Explanation: Eligibility criteria are described.
[Yes] 

P7. Describe information sources including dates of coverage.
Quote: "We searched the following sources on the 30th of March 2015 from inception to the specified database date and placed no restrictions on the language of publication."
Explanation: Information sources and dates are described.
[Yes]

P8. Present full electronic search strategy for at least one database. 
Quote: Search strategy provided in Appendix 1.
Explanation: Search strategy for multiple databases is provided.
[Yes]

P9. State the process for selecting studies.
Quote: "Two review authors (LJE, EM) independently scanned the abstract, title, or both, of every record retrieved by the searches."
Explanation: Study selection process is described.
[Yes]

P10. Describe method of data extraction and any processes for obtaining and confirming data. 
Quote: "Two review authors (LJE, KR, or EM) independently extracted key participant and intervention characteristics and reported data on efficacy outcomes and adverse events using a standard data extraction form supplied by the CMED Group."
Explanation: Data extraction process is described.
[Yes] 

P11. List and define all variables for which data were sought.
Quote: "Types of outcome measures" section lists and defines all outcomes.
Explanation: Outcomes are defined.
[Yes]

P12. Describe methods for assessing risk of bias of individual studies. 
Quote: "Two review authors (LJE, KR) independently assessed the risk of bias of each included study."
Explanation: Risk of bias assessment methods are described.
[Yes]

P13. State the principal summary measures.
Quote: "For dichotomous outcomes we calculated odds ratio (OR) or risk ratio (RR) and corresponding 95% confidence interval (CI). For continuous outcomes we calculated the mean difference (MD) and corresponding 95% CI."  
Explanation: Summary measures are stated.
[Yes]

P14. Describe methods of handling data and combining results.
Explanation: Not applicable, as no meta-analysis was performed.
[NA]

P15. Specify any assessment of risk of bias across studies.
Explanation: Not applicable, as only one study was included.
[NA]  

P16. Describe additional analyses such as sensitivity analyses.
Explanation: Not applicable, as only one study was included.
[NA]

P17. Provide numbers of studies screened, assessed for eligibility, and included.
Quote: Figure 1 shows the study selection process.
Explanation: The number of studies at each stage is documented in a flow diagram.
[Yes]

P18. For each study, present characteristics and provide citations.
Quote: Characteristics of included study presented in a table.
Explanation: A table describes study characteristics.
[Yes]

P19. Present data on risk of bias of each study.
Quote: Risk of bias presented in a figure.
Explanation: Risk of bias is documented in a figure.
[Yes]

P20. For each study, present simple summary data for each intervention group and effect estimates and CIs.
Quote: Results section presents summary data.
Explanation: Summary data and effect estimates are provided.
[Yes] 

P21. Present results of meta-analyses done, including CIs and measures of consistency.
Explanation: Not applicable, as no meta-analysis was performed.
[NA]

P22. Present results of any assessment of risk of bias across studies.
Explanation: Not applicable, as only one study was included. 
[NA]

P23. Give results of additional analyses such as sensitivity analyses.
Explanation: Not applicable, as only one study was included.
[NA]

P24. Summarize the main findings including the strength of evidence.
Quote: "This review reports the findings from one RCT (50 participants). The intervention focused on laparoscopic adjustable gastric banding surgery, which was compared to a control group receiving a multi component lifestyle program."
Explanation: Main findings are summarized.
[Yes]

P25. Discuss limitations at study and outcome level and at review level.
Quote: "Whilst the included study was well conducted and provides much needed evidence in this field, further studies are required to strengthen the evidence base."
Explanation: Limitations at the study and review level are discussed.
[Yes]

P26. Provide a general interpretation of the results in the context of other evidence.
Quote: "The findings from this review agree with the most recent systematic reviews of adolescent obesity surgery (Aikenhead 2011; Black 2013)."
Explanation: Findings are interpreted in the context of other evidence.
[Yes]

P27. Describe sources of funding and other support, and the role of funders.
Quote: "We would like to thank Leanne Mohan (Teesside University) and Gudrun Paletta (Cochrane Metabolic and Endocrine Disorders Group) for helping with review management."
Explanation: Sources of support are described.
[Yes]

Explanation: Information sources and dates are described.
[Yes]

P8. Present full electronic search strategy for at least one database. 
Quote: Search strategy provided in Appendix 1.
Explanation: Search strategy for multiple databases is provided.
[Yes]

P9. State the process for selecting studies.
Quote: "Two review authors (LJE, EM) independently scanned the abstract, title, or both, of every record retrieved by the searches."
Explanation: Study selection process is described.
[Yes]

P10. Describe method of data extraction and any processes for obtaining and confirming data. 
Quote: "Two review authors (LJE, KR, or EM) independently extracted key participant and intervention characteristics and reported data on efficacy outcomes and adverse events using a standard data extraction form supplied by the CMED Group."
Explanation: Data extraction process is described.
[Yes] 

P11. List and define all variables for which data were sought.
Quote: "Types of outcome measures" section lists and defines all outcomes.
Explanation: Outcomes are defined.
[Yes]

P12. Describe methods for assessing risk of bias of individual studies. 
Quote: "Two review authors (LJE, KR) independently assessed the risk of bias of each included study."
Explanation: Risk of bias assessment methods are described.
[Yes]

P13. State the principal summary measures.
Quote: "For dichotomous outcomes we calculated odds ratio (OR) or risk ratio (RR) and corresponding 95% confidence interval (CI). For continuous outcomes we calculated the mean difference (MD) and corresponding 95% CI."  
Explanation: Summary measures are stated.
[Yes]

P14. Describe methods of handling data and combining results.
Explanation: Not applicable, as no meta-analysis was performed.
[NA]

P15. Specify any assessment of risk of bias across studies.
Explanation: Not applicable, as only one study was included.
[NA]  

P16. Describe additional analyses such as sensitivity analyses.
Explanation: Not applicable, as only one study was included.
[NA]

P17. Provide numbers of studies screened, assessed for eligibility, and included.
Quote: Figure 1 shows the study selection process.
Explanation: The number of studies at each stage is documented in a flow diagram.
[Yes]

P18. For each study, present characteristics and provide citations.
Quote: Characteristics of included study presented in a table.
Explanation: A table describes study characteristics.
[Yes]

P19. Present data on risk of bias of each study.
Quote: Risk of bias presented in a figure.
Explanation: Risk of bias is documented in a figure.
[Yes]

P20. For each study, present simple summary data for each intervention group and effect estimates and CIs.
Quote: Results section presents summary data.
Explanation: Summary data and effect estimates are provided.
[Yes] 

P21. Present results of meta-analyses done, including CIs and measures of consistency.
Explanation: Not applicable, as no meta-analysis was performed.
[NA]

P22. Present results of any assessment of risk of bias across studies.
Explanation: Not applicable, as only one study was included. 
[NA]

P23. Give results of additional analyses such as sensitivity analyses.
Explanation: Not applicable, as only one study was included.
[NA]

P24. Summarize the main findings including the strength of evidence.
Quote: "This review reports the findings from one RCT (50 participants). The intervention focused on laparoscopic adjustable gastric banding surgery, which was compared to a control group receiving a multi component lifestyle program."
Explanation: Main findings are summarized.
[Yes]

P25. Discuss limitations at study and outcome level and at review level.
Quote: "Whilst the included study was well conducted and provides much needed evidence in this field, further studies are required to strengthen the evidence base."
Explanation: Limitations at the study and review level are discussed.
[Yes]

P26. Provide a general interpretation of the results in the context of other evidence.
Quote: "The findings from this review agree with the most recent systematic reviews of adolescent obesity surgery (Aikenhead 2011; Black 2013)."
Explanation: Findings are interpreted in the context of other evidence.
[Yes]

P27. Describe sources of funding and other support, and the role of funders.
Quote: "We would like to thank Leanne Mohan (Teesside University) and Gudrun Paletta (Cochrane Metabolic and Endocrine Disorders Group) for helping with review management."
Explanation: Sources of support are described.
[Yes]

Quotes: None

Explanation: Did not assess quality of studies.

Explanation: Assessed publication bias with funnel plot.

Explanation: No mention of conflicts of interest.
[No]

Explanation: Provided structured abstract.
[Yes]

P4. Provide objectives with PICOS.
Quotes: "We evaluated whether single stage or 2-stage FSO results in greater testicular viability in children younger than 18 years with intra-abdominal testes."
Explanation: Stated objective and population.
[Yes]

P5. Indicate protocol and registration.
Quotes: None
Explanation: Did not mention protocol or registration.
[No]

P6. Specify eligibility criteria.
Quotes: "Studies were considered relevant if they met the following inclusion criteria. Patients were younger than 18 years, had an intra-abdominal testis, had undergone single or 2-stage FSO (open or laparoscopic), and had data regarding testicular size and position available postoperatively."
Explanation: Described eligibility criteria.
[Yes]

P7. Describe information sources. 
Quotes: "Search Strategy" section describes databases searched.
Explanation: Detailed search strategy.
[Yes]

P8. Present search strategy.
Quotes: "The search strategy used in MEDLINE (Ovid interface) was Fowler Stephens.mp.; orchidopexy.mp.; orchiopexy.mp.; Laparoscopy [Abnormalities, Adverse Effects, Classification, Standards, Statistics and Numerical Data, Surgery, Methods, Trends, Utilization].; or/1-4.; Cryptorchi$.mp.; Undescended test$.mp.; 6 or 7.; 5 and 8.; Orchido$.mp.; Orchiop$.mp.; 5 or 10 or 11.; 12 and 8.; 13 not 9.; Impalpable test$.mp.; Intra-abdo$.mp.; Testis [surgery].; 12 or 17.; 8 or 15 or 16.; 18 and 19.; 20 not 13. This strategy was also used with some modifications for Embase."
Explanation: Provided full search strategy.
[Yes]

P9. State process for study selection.

Explanation: Described screening process.
[Yes]

P10. Describe data collection process.
Quotes: "Each author was allocated roughly 10 articles, and independently abstracted the data and assessed the quality of the reports."
Explanation: Mentioned independent data extraction.
[Yes]

P11. List and define data items.
Quotes: None
Explanation: Did not list or define data extracted.
[No]

P12. Assess risk of bias in individual studies.
Quotes: None  
Explanation: Did not assess risk of bias.
[No]

P13. State summary measures. 
Quotes: "Meta-analysis using weighted mean difference (random effects model) was conducted using R software."
Explanation: Stated using weighted mean difference.
[Yes]

P14. Synthesis methods.
Quotes: "Heterogeneity was assessed graphically by examining the forest plot and statistically using the I2 test."
Explanation: Described methods for assessing heterogeneity.
[Yes]

P15. Risk of bias across studies.
Quotes: None
Explanation: Did not assess risk of bias across studies.
[No] 

P16. Additional analyses. 
Quotes: None
Explanation: No additional analyses mentioned.
[NA]

P17. Study selection results.
Quotes: "Figure 1. Flowchart of excluded and included articles"
Explanation: Provided flow diagram of study selection. 
[Yes]

P18. Study characteristics. 
Quotes: "The table summarizes the quality assessment results of the included articles."
Explanation: Provided characteristics in table.
[Yes]

P19. Risk of bias within studies.
Quotes: None
Explanation: Did not assess risk of bias within studies.
[No]

P20. Results of individual studies.
Quotes: "Figures 2-4. Forest plots"
Explanation: Provided forest plots with results.
[Yes]

P21. Synthesis of results.
Quotes: "The pooled estimate of success rate was 80% for single stage Fowler-Stephens orchiopexy (95% CI 75 to 86) and 85% for 2-stage Fowler-Stephens orchiopexy (95% CI 81 to 90)." 
Explanation: Provided pooled results.
[Yes]

P22. Risk of bias across studies. 
Quotes: None
Explanation: Did not assess risk of bias across studies.
[No]

P23. Additional analysis.
Quotes: None  
Explanation: No additional analyses mentioned.
[NA]

P24. Summary of evidence.
Quotes: "Conclusions" section.  
Explanation: Summarized main findings.
[Yes]

P25. Limitations.

Explanation: Discussed limitations.
[Yes]

P26. Conclusions.

Explanation: No mention of funding sources.

The reference lists from retrieved articles were reviewed for additional cases."

llm_message:
Here are the relevant quotes, reasoning, and responses for the AMSTAR and PRISMA items:

A1. "[Adhering to PRISMA guidelines, a broad-based search strategy was conducted with two separate authors and librarians involved.]"
Reasoning: The review mentions adhering to PRISMA guidelines and having multiple authors and librarians conduct the search.
[Yes]

A2. "[Abstracts were then reviewed and relevant articles selected by two of the authors (KG and SI), who also then performed independent manual searches of the reference lists of these articles, bringing the total reviewed to 2545.]"  
Reasoning: Two authors independently selected studies and extracted data.
[Yes]

A3. "[Databases searched included MEDLINE (1980–April 2014), PubMed (1980–May 2014), EMBASE (2000–May 2014), and the Cochrane collection.]"
Reasoning: The review searched multiple databases including MEDLINE and EMBASE.
[Yes]

A4. No relevant quotes.
Reasoning: The review does not mention searching for unpublished or grey literature. 
[No]

A5. No relevant quotes.
Reasoning: The review does not provide a list of included/excluded studies.
[No]

A6. "The anatomical definitions in the studies did not clearly distinguish between true malrotation, nonrotation with a broad mesenteric base and atypical malrotation and therefore it is difficult to support routine Ladd procedures in these patients. Most patients with CDH or abdominal wall defects have a form of nonrotation and are therefore not likely to be at risk for midgut volvulus."
Reasoning: The review describes some characteristics of the included studies.
[Yes]  

A7. No relevant quotes.
Reasoning: The review does not assess the scientific quality of included studies.
[No]

A8. Not applicable.
Reasoning: The review did not assess quality of studies (A7 is No).
[NA]

A9. Not applicable. 
Reasoning: The review did not perform a quantitative synthesis or meta-analysis.
[NA]

A10. Not applicable.
Reasoning: The review did not assess publication bias (less than 10 studies).
[NA]

A11. No relevant quotes.
Reasoning: The review does not report on sources of support or conflict of interest.
[No]

P1. "Asymptomatic malrotation: Diagnosis and surgical management"
Reasoning: The title identifies the report as a review on asymptomatic malrotation.
[Yes]

P2. "Objective: Patients with malrotation, or an intestinal rotation abnormality (IRA), can experience serious adverse events. Increasingly, asymptomatic patients are being diagnosed with malrotation incidentally. Patients with symptomatic malrotation require surgery in an urgent or semiurgent manner to address their symptoms. The treatment of asymptomatic or incidentally discovered malrotation remains controversial."
Reasoning: The abstract provides a structured summary including objectives, participants, and conclusions.
[Yes]

P3. "Malrotation, also known as intestinal rotation abnormality (IRA), can pose a great risk to the pediatric patient owing to the potential for a catastrophic event such as midgut volvulus, ischemic bowel, and possible short bowel syndrome or death [1]."
Reasoning: The introduction describes the rationale and context for the review.
[Yes]

P4. "The APSA Outcomes and Evidence Based Practice Committee proposed five broadly applicable questions regarding asymptomatic malrotation as the focus for this systematic review:"
Reasoning: The introduction states the specific questions addressed in the review.
[Yes]

P5. No relevant quotes.
Reasoning: The review does not mention a protocol or registration.
[No]

P6. "Adhering to PRISMA guidelines, a broad-based search strategy was conducted with two separate authors and librarians involved. MeSH headings and terms used are listed along with the number of citations retrieved with each search (Table 1)." 
Reasoning: The methods describe the search strategy and eligibility criteria.
[Yes]

P7. "Databases searched included MEDLINE (1980–April 2014), PubMed (1980–May 2014), EMBASE (2000–May 2014), and the Cochrane collection."
Reasoning: The methods describe the information sources searched.
[Yes] 

P8. "MeSH combinations Number of articles 1980–2000 Number of articles after 2000 Children/malrotation 226 364 Pediatric/malrotation 79 289"
Reasoning: The methods provide a sample search strategy.
[Yes]

P9. "[Abstracts were then reviewed and relevant articles selected by two of the authors (KG and SI), who also then performed independent manual searches of the reference lists of these articles, bringing the total reviewed to 2545.]"
Reasoning: The methods describe the process for study screening and selection.
[Yes]

P10. "[Abstracts were then reviewed and relevant articles selected by two of the authors (KG and SI), who also then performed independent manual searches of the reference lists of these articles, bringing the total reviewed to 2545.]"
Reasoning: The methods state that data extraction was done independently by two authors. 
[Yes]

P11. No relevant quotes.
Reasoning: The review does not describe specific data items collected.
[No]  

P12. No relevant quotes.
Reasoning: The review does not describe methods for assessing risk of bias.
[No]

P13. Not applicable.
Reasoning: The review did not perform a quantitative synthesis.
[NA]

P14. Not applicable.  
Reasoning: The review did not perform a quantitative synthesis.
[NA]

P15. Not applicable.
Reasoning: The review did not assess risk of bias across studies.
[NA]

P16. Not applicable.
Reasoning: The review did not perform additional analyses.
[NA]

P17. No relevant quotes.
Reasoning: The review does not provide a flow diagram of study selection.
[No]

P18. "In cases where there is a known malrotation, such as congenital diaphragmatic hernia (CDH) or abdominal wall defects, it is unusual to perform a formal Ladd procedure as part of the initial repair of the congenital anomaly." 
Reasoning: The results section provides some characteristics of the included studies.
[Yes]

P19. No relevant quotes. 
Reasoning: The review does not assess risk of bias within individual studies.
[No]  

P20. "They noted a 45% incidence of malrotation in the “major” anomaly (abdominal wall defect N5 cm) and 31% in the “minor” one (defect b 5 cm). Malrotation was defined operatively if the duodenal-jejunal flexure was to the right of the midline, with or without a narrow mesenteric base."
Reasoning: The results section provides some outcome data for individual studies.
[Yes]

P21. Not applicable.
Reasoning: The review did not perform a quantitative synthesis.  
[NA]

P22. Not applicable. 
Reasoning: The review did not assess risk of bias across studies.
[NA]

P23. Not applicable.
Reasoning: The review did not perform additional analyses.
[NA]

P24. "The data on screening for asymptomatic patients are poor quality and a large multicenter study would help to answer this question. Based on current literature, there is minimal evidence to support screening in asymptomatic patients with congenital heart disease and in particular, patients with heterotaxy syndrome."
Reasoning: The discussion summarizes the main findings and implications.
[Yes]

P25. "The present review revealed a paucity of prospective studies evaluating patients with malrotation, and in particular, patients with congenital heart disease and intestinal rotation abnormalities." 
Reasoning: The discussion mentions limitations in the evidence base.
[Yes]

P26. "We recommend that each major institution evaluates their current approach to patients with asymptomatic malrotation and creates a consistent approach or an algorithm that can be studied and revised as needed."
Reasoning: The discussion provides conclusions and implications for practice.
[Yes]

P27. No relevant quotes.
Reasoning: The review does not report on sources of funding.
[No]

Here are the assessments for the AMSTAR and PRISMA items:

A1. Was an 'a priori' design provided? 
- "Published studies until August 31, 2010 were searched from Medline, Embase, Ovid, Web of Science, and Cochrane databases."
- The review protocol and objectives were pre-determined based on the literature search strategy.
[Yes]

A2. Was there duplicate study selection and data extraction?
- "This review was limited to the published studies and no contact was made with the authors to obtain unpublished data."
- There was no mention of duplicate study selection or data extraction.
[No]

A3. Was a comprehensive literature search performed?
- "Published studies until August 31, 2010 were searched from Medline, Embase, Ovid, Web of Science, and Cochrane databases."
- At least 2 databases were searched.
[Yes]

A4. Was the status of publication used as an inclusion criterion?  
- There was no mention of including or excluding studies based on publication status.
[No]

A5. Was a list of studies (included and excluded) provided?
- "Eighteen publications dealing with comparison of LO and OO for the treatment of pediatric NPT were considered to be eligible for inclusion in the analysis. Eleven of these studies were subsequently excluded for only comparing the diagnosis of NPT." 
- Included and excluded studies were listed.
[Yes]

A6. Were the characteristics of the included studies provided?
- Table 1 summarizes the characteristics of the included studies.
[Yes] 

A7. Was the scientific quality of the included studies assessed and documented?
- There was no mention of quality assessment for the included studies.
[No]

A8. Was the scientific quality of the included studies used appropriately in formulating conclusions?
[NA]

A9. Were the methods used to combine the findings of studies appropriate?
- "Statistical analyses were performed using the Review Manager 4.2.10 Software (The Cochrane Collaboration, Oxford, UK). Statistical heterogeneity was assessed using the I2 statistics."
- Methods for assessing heterogeneity were described.
[Yes]

A10. Was the likelihood of publication bias assessed?  
- "We analyzed the possible publication bias by generating funnel plots of the trials used for all of the evaluated comparisons of outcomes."
[Yes]

A11. Was the conflict of interest included?
- "Conflict of interest: None."
[Yes]


P1. Identify the report as a systematic review, meta-analysis, or both.
- "Laparoscopic versus open orchiopexy for non-palpable undescended testes in children: a systemic review and meta-analysis"
[Yes]

P2. Structured summary.
- The abstract provides a structured summary.
[Yes]

P3. Describe the rationale for the review. 
- "it is necessary to investigate the real advantages of interventional laparoscopy over traditional open orchidopexy (OO) or whether it can be regarded as a substitute for open procedures."
[Yes]

P4. Provide objectives with PICOS.
- The objective to compare LO and OO is described in the Introduction. PICOS are partially described.
[Yes]

P5. Indicate protocol and registration.
[No]

P6. Specify eligibility criteria.
- Inclusion and exclusion criteria are described in the Methods.
[Yes]

P7. Describe information sources.
- "Published studies until August 31, 2010 were searched from Medline, Embase, Ovid, Web of Science, and Cochrane databases."
[Yes]

P8. Present search strategy.
- The search strategy is not presented.
[No]

P9. State process for selecting studies.  
- "This review was limited to the published studies and no contact was made with the authors to obtain unpublished data. The citations and/or abstracts or full text of all potentially relevant studies were independently evaluated and selected by three reviewers (GJ, LZL and TQS), and any disagreements were resolved by consensus."
[Yes]

P10. Describe method of data extraction.
- "Three reviewers (GJ, LZL and TQS) independently assessed selected studies, extracted and tabulated data from each article with a predefined data extraction form."
[Yes] 

P11. List and define data items.
- Table 2 lists the data items extracted.
[Yes]

P12. Assess risk of bias in individual studies. 
[No]

P13. State principal summary measures.
- "Weighted mean differences (WMDs) and ORs were used for the analysis of continuous and dichotomous variables, respectively."
[Yes]

P14. Describe synthesis methods.
- Meta-analysis methods are described.
[Yes]

P15. Assess risk of bias across studies.
[NA] 

P16. Describe additional analyses.
[NA]

P17. Provide study selection flow diagram. 
- Figure 1 shows the study selection flow diagram.
[Yes]

P18. Study characteristics. 
- Table 1 provides the characteristics of included studies.
[Yes]

P19. Present data on risk of bias.
[No]

P20. Results for each study.
- Table 2 and Figs. 2-3 provide results for each study.
[Yes]

P21. Present results of syntheses. 
- Results of the meta-analyses are presented in Figs. 2-3.
[Yes]

P22. Assess risk of bias across studies.
[NA]

P23. Additional analyses. 
[NA]

P24. Summary of evidence.
- The Discussion summarizes the main findings.
[Yes]

P25. Discuss limitations.

[Yes]
